Confidence intervals for
differences of standardized regression slopes
are generated using
the `DiffBetaNB()` function from the `betaNB` package.
In this example,
we use the data set and the model used in
[betaNB: Example Using the BetaNB Function](example-beta-nb.html).


``` r
library(betaNB)
```




``` r
df <- betaNB::nas1982
```

### Regression

Fit the regression model using the `lm()` function.


``` r
object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)
```

### Nonparametric Bootstrap


``` r
nb <- NB(object)
```

### Differences of Standardized Regression Slopes

#### Normal-Theory Approach


``` r
out <- DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05)
```

## Methods

### summary

Summary of the results of `DiffBetaNB()`.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "pc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "pc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1333 5000 -0.1556 0.3712
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1241 5000 -0.0112 0.4802
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1274 5000 -0.1205 0.3794
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1333 5000 -0.1579 0.3686
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1241 5000 -0.0088 0.4826
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1274 5000 -0.1190 0.3801
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bca")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bca"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1333 5000 -0.1583 0.3669
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1241 5000 -0.0106 0.4807
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1274 5000 -0.1073 0.3984
```

### coef

Return the vector of estimates.


``` r
coef(out)
#>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 
#>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410
```

### vcov

Return the sampling covariance matrix.


``` r
vcov(out)
#>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.017756059    0.008464001   -0.009292057
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.008464001    0.015396205    0.006932204
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.009292057    0.006932204    0.016224261
```

### confint

Return confidence intervals.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "pc")
#>                      2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.15563794 0.3712169
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.01115064 0.4801960
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.12051161 0.3793863
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bc")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.157900651 0.3685534
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.008790581 0.4826215
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.119007299 0.3801320
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bca")
#>                      2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.15832753 0.3668927
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.01064854 0.4807284
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.10726860 0.3983690
```
